alert.note: Alert for Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 11:07AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 15 inches possible. * WHERE...Snowy and Judith Mountains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
